;Tang Limei finally lived the fulfilling life she had dreamed of. Waking up early and staying late has become the norm. Getting up at 4 a.m. to go to the airport and returning home at 1:30 a.m. after finishing the day's activities is not an exception. Not staying out overnight is partly to take care of my young daughter’s emotions, but also to satisfy her pursuit of efficiency.

;

;She rarely used it to catch up on sleep when flying, but still raced against time to read and think. Since 2013, she has continued to travel to campuses of all ages, TV studios, events, lectures, forums, and dining tables used for live broadcasts and writing, sharing her deep dives in the Western Pacific with the "Jiaolong" Scientific expedition and the experience of participating in the 34th Antarctic Scientific Expedition.

;

;At first, she only gave lectures as a scientist as a researcher at the Second Institute of Oceanography of the Ministry of Natural Resources. Over the past ten years, she has gradually been dubbed a science popularization expert because of her tireless science popularization and vivid and humorous narration. title. In the past two years, she has won important honors such as Top Ten Science Communication Figures in China, Chief Science Communication Expert, and Female Science Popularization Expert.

;

;On the day of the interview, she spared a few hours, ate a sandwich at noon, and rushed home to prepare for the live broadcast at 4 p.m. Not long ago, she went to attend classes at universities and party schools. The topic she taught was the core of leadership from the perspective of biological evolution, from natural science to humanities and then to philosophy (;This is her usual style;), recalling her hearty smile and said, "There was no urine in the whole process"; then she was also invited to participate in a TED speech, the theme was "If your major is a transfer, you What will happen next in life?”

;

;Experienced the transition from engineering to science (;Undergraduate survey technology and engineering, postgraduate geological engineering, doctoral geology

; span>;), Tang Limei decided to switch his research field to marine geology after listening to a lecture by chance while studying for his PhD. He realized early on that life has no limits and is full of unexpected and unplanned nodes.

;

;With ten years of accumulation in science popularization, she will bring a new book "Exploring the Deep Sea with the "Dragon"" at the end of 2023 to show people a new face of a science popularization writer. The book will introduce the basic knowledge of the ocean (;For example, what is the sea, what is the ocean, how to form;), the five major oceans of the world (;Newly included in the Southern Ocean in 2021;)'s cutting-edge knowledge, personal experience in deep-sea exploration, and the development history of the country's manned deep submersibles, etc.

;

;It took less than half a year to write the book. She was busier than before. She didn't even have time to wash her face after getting up every morning. She said that her days now consist of only three things: work, exercise, and reading and thinking. She has been able to maintain her body shape for nearly 20 years after getting up early for a run. During the interview, she was wearing the team uniform she wore during the Antarctic scientific expedition in 2017, and it still fit her perfectly.

;

;Other than that, there are very few pastimes, and I hardly watch movies. Everything I do must "generate value and meaning." She would refuse without hesitation if asked to travel to the beach. Only when it became a matter of spending time with her children and family would she be willing to do so. "I can't go out to play by myself, but I'm willing to do it with others. It's valuable."

;

;She recalled more than ten years ago when life was not so full. , I still have plenty of time to watch "The Legend of Zhen Huan", and during the period when I went to the Pacific to "isolate", I watched it intermittently nearly 20 times in total. "It wouldn't be so busy then. I would definitely choose to read a book now." It wasn't until 2022 that she turned the content of the TV series into a class, and then she finally let go of the time wasted.

;

;;

;

;Ocean Open Class;(video screenshot/picture);

;

;The lecture content revolves around "Zhen Huan" "Scientific trivia in the Biography", "For example, there is an episode where the emperor went to An Lingrong's place to celebrate her birthday. He was very tired of eating, so he happened to get him some light pastries. Why do we eat dessert after a meal? It's because we The perception of sweetness is at the tip of the tongue, and the perception of bitterness is at the back of the tongue, and then there are other areas in the middle, such as spicy food. Therefore, we can still eat something sweet after a meal because we can feel sweetness at the tip of the tongue at the earliest. ."

;

;"There is also braised pork, which is the Maillard reaction. Isn't the Maillard color popular this year? Maillard is actually caramel color, which is what it turns into after the sugar is burned. Color, what happens between it and braised pork is the Maillard reaction. Why do we need to add sugar? When you make braised pork, you can educate your children about science. These knowledge points are closely related to life; and why do we have oleander powder? Poisonous? I explained its formula, and then what is the most poisonous part of it? Tree trunks, leaves and flowers are all poisonous. Finally, why are these women fighting in the play? These are the backward ideas of feudal society. Let’s talk about it finally. The awakening of women in our new era includes humanistic methods."

;

;She believes that subject segmentation is actually unscientific because "all knowledge is interlinked" and is often lacking in the dissemination of knowledge. Not even one. She likes the title of "Science Communication Figure", "It's quite appropriate. Just like preaching, science is also a cognitive system."

;

;She looks at everything around her with a comprehensive view of the universe and cherishes it. Curious, "Actually, everything is learning. You may have thought it was entertainment before, but with a learning mentality, if you really understand the background, culture or meaning of TV series, movies and other cultural works, it is actually learning.";

;In her spare time during the Antarctic scientific expedition, Tang Limei also watched a few sporadic movies, including the literary film "Sunset Trilogy" series, which she also watched repeatedly. What attracts her is not the romantic encounter between the male and female protagonists, but the social topics that the two communicate and discuss from sunset to sunrise. "In fact, the most attractive thing about it is its topic. It is not that two people are in love, they discuss They are all the destruction of society by developed countries, the infringement of weak countries, the garbage we produce now, the underlying logic of society, etc."

;

;She has also watched some of "Celebrating More Than Years" and she likes it. With time-travel elements, I am also planning to write some science fiction novels next, "For example, two fishes (;because we humans evolved from fish (;), a story of pure love that has gone through five mass extinctions, nine evolutions, and then traveled through several lives. In this long evolution, "The Three-Body Problem" is set in the universe. It may be based on the hundreds of millions of years of biological evolution."

;

;Now that she is in the conceptual stage, she is already very excited. "It should be particularly enjoyable if I write it later. In fact, this is a process of creation. The meaning of life lies in creation. Only when you create something you love, will you feel happy and in a flow."

;

; In 2019, she participated in a training session at the Youth League School of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, and later became a member of the Youth Lecturers Group of the Central Committee of the Communist Youth League. Since then, she has frequently given lectures in colleges and universities. She noticed that the new generation of young people are increasingly concerned about spiritual values. "Public welfare must be the trend in the future. There will definitely be more and more people engaged in charity and volunteer services among the post-2000 generation, because it may be difficult for them to make a rapid economic leap from their work, so they will look for other ways. To realize your own value, engage more in charity and manual work, that is, to help others and feel happiness from the process of serving others."

;

;"There will be more and more of these industries, like my daughter, What can you say to make her feel happy? It’s not that her mother went to her school and gave a speech. Everyone regarded me as an idol and worshiped me. This was a pressure for her; her happiness was similar to that once I took her to a friend's birthday party, and after she gave the butterfly she made with a twist stick to someone else, she felt sincerely happy because of the other person's gratitude."

;

;The first book has not yet been released, and it is non-stop. Tang Limei has already begun to imagine her future "writing ambitions". "If I publish one book every year, I can probably write 20 more in my life. I hope one or two of them will be popular science classics for teenagers." Through these words again and again. and written words. What she is committed to disseminating is not only scientific knowledge, but also "the meaning of life." She hopes that her slightly tortuous but persevering experience can inspire young people and make those young faces in the audience understand, "Everyone should have their own way out and live well."

;

;;Newcomer Wu Kangren;

;

;Wu Kangren is standing in the middle of the lobby of a hotel in Xiamen, dancing and talking with people. The companion said: "Please be gentle and don't attract too much attention."

;

;"No one will pay attention to us. Everyone is living their own lives." He waved his hand.

;

;The most watched Taiwanese actor at the moment, the favorite to win the Golden Horse Award this year, has long been able to get along with his fame calmly.

;

;In the first few years when he became famous, he avoided the public and social media, wore a mask when going out, and hated being stared at. By 2015, he left his agent to work independently. Just before he was about to win his first Golden Bell Award, Wu Kangren suddenly took off his mask. "Wearing a mask is uncomfortable," he said.

;

;When someone looked at him, he looked back with a smile; when someone patted him, he waved his hand from a distance; when someone stared at him, he slowly changed his position to avoid it.

;

;“When I didn’t care much about what other people thought of me, I felt a lot less burdened.” Wu Kangren said, “I began to realize that the identity I originally cared about was just my career and an external label. . I want to get back my identity and my life. What I have to do at the moment is the most important, such as going out to buy things."

;

;In the past ten years, Wu Kangren has starred in many word-of-mouth movies. Taiwanese dramas, from the early years of "A Handful of Youth" (2015), "Narcotic Storm" (2015), and "The Distance Between Us and Evil" (2019), to this year's "Copycat" and "In This Lifetime" and so on.

;

;;

;

;Anesthesia Storm (2015) ;;

;

;;

;

;The distance between us and evil (2019) ;;

;

;;

;

;Copycat (2023) ;;

;

;Although Wu Kangren always says that no one knows him every time he comes to the mainland, and he mostly observes from the sidelines; even though the mainland media always give him this title repeatedly - "The most powerful Chinese TV star!" He should have been popular! "But every time he came to the mainland in the past five years, he had a busy schedule, and everywhere he went there were crowds and cheers. In Xiamen, young people shouted to him: "Gao Jiayue, praise, praise, praise!" "Gao Jiayue is his character in the new drama "Lifetime", and his catchphrase is "Zan Zan Zan". At the post-screening event of the movie "Fudu Youth", many viewers expressed happily: Wu Kangren, I have liked you for many years, I hope you can win this year's Golden Horse Best Actor!

;

;"Fudu Youth" is directed by Malaysian director Ong Lilian and stars Wu Kangren and Chen Chak Yao. It has won awards at many international film festivals. Wu Kangren won this year's First Youth Award Best Actor at the Film Festival.

;

;He received the First trophy in Xiamen, took a group photo, and then held it halfway. He was also the Best Actor in this year's First Film Festival media selection. When he heard that there were also trophies for the venue selection, he shook with joy.

;

;He cherishes every recognition he gets, whether it is an award or the favor of his seniors. This is why he often plays guest roles. : To repay a favor. He made a cameo appearance as a pervert who sexually harassed a female subordinate in the TV series "Her and Her Her", but he couldn't find an actor for this disgusting role. Out of gratitude for the producer of the show who had taken care of him in the past, Wu Kangren took over the role. The original male lead of "Copycat" missed the appointment due to schedule, and the crew was at a standstill. They were in urgent need of a replacement who could be accepted by Netflix. It was Wu Kangren again. In order not to affect the follow-up film appointments, he rushed to work for 16 days in a row. He only sleeps two or three hours a day.

;

;He thanked Chen Huiling, the director of "Next Stop, Happiness" many times. "(To the director) jokingly said that there was no opportunity to perform in "Next Stop" at that time, maybe now I was still serving plates in restaurants and stuff like that, but I actually meant it. "

;

;In 2009, Wu Kangren starred in the idol drama "Next Stop, Happiness" as Hua Takuya, the second male lead who silently protected the heroine for many years and finally let go. He created a chapter in the history of Taiwanese idol dramas Classic: With tears in his eyes, he suppressed the sadness rushing out of his chest, and said to the heroine with a smile: "Why, I was the one who met you first, but you still chose to lead him six years ago and six years later. hand. ”

;

;;

;

;Next Stop, Happiness (2009) ;;

;

;"I watched it for the first time He was surprised when he was acting, how could someone crying be so touching. I asked director Chen Huiling, and the director said it was because he was acting with his life. "said screenwriter Lu Shiyuan. Wu Kangren later became the leading actor in her works "The Exit Office" and "The Distance Between Us and Evil". Both of these dramas brought Wu Kangren nominations for Best Actor at the Golden Bell Awards.;

;In this way, Wu Kangren, who had just quit his job as a bartender, emerged with "Hua Tuoye". At the age of 27, he encountered his favorite job: acting. "After acting reaches a certain stage, it is no longer for me. A way to make money for a living. "

;

;However, "Next Stop, Happiness" was the last peak of Taiwanese idol dramas. Since then, Taiwanese dramas, which have been popular in Asia for ten years, have been declining. What is mutually responsible for the decline of Taiwanese dramas is that mainland TV dramas and Korean dramas gradually occupied Taiwanese TV stations, and Taiwanese dramas that lost their audience also lost the funds of the TV stations. It was also at that time that the backbone of Taiwanese dramas and future stars, such as Ethan Ruan, Zhao Youting, Chen Bolin, Ariel Ariel, Chen Qiaoen, etc., all turned to the mainland Development.

;

;Newcomer Wu Kangren stayed in Taiwan and worked hard to act in his own way.

;

;;Like a foreign worker;

;

;Starring "Fudu Youth" was won by Wu Kangren.

;

;What he saw was the synopsis of the venture capital period. He liked it very much after reading it, so he met with Wang Lilin. The atmosphere of the meeting was harmonious, but there was no further discussion after that. Contact us.

;

;In the next eight months, Wu Kangren finished filming two movies and was resting at home. One day he was staring at his cat and suddenly felt that filming in Taiwan was out of his comfort zone, and he wanted to change places. He thought of "Fudu Youth", so he called the director and asked if you were still filming and if you didn't plan to find me.

;

;"The director also told me honestly: they do have other candidates. . But I feel that I am very sincere and can go to Malaysia a month earlier and the (remuneration) can be cheaper. "

;

;For Wu Kangren, "Fudu Youth" is a rare opportunity. Nowadays, professional dramas are popular in Taiwan. He has portrayed etiquette masters, lawyers, prosecutors, etc. He has also tried many unconventional characters, For example, mamasang, habitual thieves who steal women's underwear, etc. This is how he trains himself.

;

;;

;

;Fudu Youth (2023) ; ;

;

;"Fudu Youth" is different. The people in the film have no career difficulties. They seem unconventional and marginal, but they actually exist in Malaysia. It tells the story of a pair of undocumented foreign workers. The brothers are living an ignoble existence in an old community in Fudu where foreign workers gather. The elder brother Abang (played by Wu Kangren) was born mute, and he works hard and accepts his fate. The younger brother Adi (played by Chen Zeyao) is unwilling to bow to fate. He only wants to make money and takes his brother with him. Leave this disgusting place.

;

;Wang Lilin is the producer of the movies "Decibel Life" and "Lost Andy". When he was filming for "Decibel Life", he observed that there were many problems in the Pudu community of Kuala Lumpur. Foreign workers, lonely elderly people, transgender people, etc. Three years later, he decided to shoot his first film with some unidentified people as the protagonists in the market of Fudu.

;

;" Since "Decibel Life", I have wanted to be close to these people, and I feel very strongly about them. "Wang Lilin said.

;

;This movie, from the director to the leading actors, followed the principle of "really listening, seeing, and feeling." After Wu Kangren and Chen Zeyao worked in the market and learned sign language for about a month, the movie was released in Filming in Fudu has officially started.

;

;Fudu has a smell. The market where you work has the smell of fish, chicken and sweet fruits, and the enclosed building where you live has the smell of food, soap, sweat and Urine.

;

;In the film, there is a close-up scene of washing hands. Wu Kangren carefully rubs each fingernail. "This is indeed an action I do every day at the end of the day, because the smell on my hands is so rich. "Wu Kangren said, "When I smoked, I smelled the smell of offal on my fingertips, so I thought, hey, I should wash it again. ”

;

;The script gives branches, but the flesh and blood of the film depends on the actors themselves.

;

;Abang makes a living by killing chickens and moving goods, so Wu Kangren killed chickens that were 20 days old— —Although the director initially did not plan to shoot a scene of killing a chicken. Eggs can be found by poking the butt of a chicken, and foreign workers often eat the eggs raw. They wanted to give them to Wu Kangren several times, and Wu Kangren repeatedly said, "Thank you, thank you, thank you."< /p>;

;Although the raw eggs were not eaten, Wu Kangren brought this detail into the movie: Abang, who came home from work, carried a bag of eggs and shared them with his neighbor and his daughter.

;

;He wanted to let I am truly like a foreign worker in a rich city. Not only can I work, but I have also become black, thin and slovenly. "When I first went there, I was like this now. I weighed more than 70 kilograms in vain. Don't spill the soup on me. appearance. " He recalled, "But when you really step into that market, you will find that everyone looks at you very differently, and you are out of place. ”

;

;He imitated the state of foreign workers, unkempt, with sweat and animal blood on his body, and the look in his eyes was tired after repeating the action of killing chickens two hundred times a day. They collected money and handed over He had no energy to have more interactions with people.

;

;He was killing chickens while approaching Fudu. He smoked, ate, and chatted with the foreign workers, looking at the expired passports they carried with them, and listening to their He talked about having a girlfriend or quarreling with his wife. He observed rats and said that he had never seen rats that looked like they had been trained. They ran past in groups, clanking and clanking, and dispersed like Moses parting the sea when they saw people. Together again.

;

;When he felt that there were no more eyes sizing him up, he knew that he could play Abang.

;

;From May to August 2022, Wu Kangren completed filming continuously In "Fudu Youth" and the Hong Kong movie "May I Live Forever", after four months of starvation, a 1.78 meter man lost weight to 53 kilograms. He did not want to say how much weight he had lost, after all, "if the film was not filmed well , everyone thinks you are just thin, what’s the big deal?”

;

;;

;

;May you live forever (2023) ;;

;

;When the film comes to an end, Abang does not eat or drink in prison and wants to die. Wu Kangren also fasted to keep himself in a state of malaise that continues to decline.

;

; He made fasting easy, saying that once he fasted his skin would be healed, white and smooth.

;

;In the past few years, Wu Kangren's weight change curve, which has waxed and waned due to his acting roles, is a series of "W"s, at 30 kg The gap fluctuated between them. When he first lost weight rapidly for the movie "Termites" (2016), he was a little optimistic, thinking that if his body changed first, he would be able to observe the psychological changes. He was also a little intentional, thinking that this might be able to be used in acting. There are unexpected effects.

;

;Before becoming an actor, he sweated and sweated on the construction site and got paid, so he firmly believed that hard work would be rewarded. He washed cups in the kitchen and had to work on the countertop and off stage. Just as clean, this later even became his belief: I, Wu Kangren, show you the same in person as I do in private.

;

;The same goes for getting fatter and thinner. No one knew what to gain by acting like this, but he wanted to know; he'd tried it, so he knew the power of shape-shifting. "I'm quite fortunate to have done this. It helped me a lot." He said, "This is irreplaceable and is self-cultivation."

;

;;Mute;

; h4>;

;When "Fudu Youth" was finalized, the crew gave Wu Kangren a cake, and he started crying when he saw the cake.

;

;"I can finally eat!" He said that he was so excited that he cried. "I went to eat chicken the day after the filming was completed!" Once again, Wu Kangren solved the difficulty with a joke.

;

;Before Abang was executed, the prison arranged for him to meet with the Master for his final confession. In this play, the director gave full play to "listening, watching, and feeling": Wu Kangren's script only has the word "accusation" and no lines; the master is a real eminent monk, Master Kaizhao who has been preaching Buddhism to death row prisoners for more than 30 years. , and there is no script.

;

;Wu Kangren and the director rehearsed the scene more than thirty times, trying to understand why Abang had such a strong reaction to release himself in such a situation. "We can imagine that he will have a display of strength in the end, but we didn't understand where the base point of strength is."

;

;;

;

;Fudu Youth (2023) ;;

;

;Due to the long preparation period and the shooting in chronological order, the actors have enough time to integrate into the characters, so when Wu Kangren heard Master Kaizhao say "live well" , suddenly mourning Abang endlessly. "Living well is the most difficult thing for him. What seems simple to us is a luxury for them. So we must start from this sentence."

;

;Abang and Adi cannot rent The house often wakes up from sleep in the middle of the night to avoid inspection; it is impossible to open a bank account, and all the working money is kept in a rusty cookie box; I cannot buy a motorcycle because I cannot get a driver's license, so I can only take the bus or walk everywhere. Without status, they will always be forced to work as laborers in Fudu.

;

;Abang once encountered love, but it was fleeting; he once thought he could live a stable life with his brother in Fudu, but his fate overturned it.

;

;But they also had their happy moments. Abang, Adi and Sister Money, a transgender person, depend on each other - in Malaysia, transgender people have no identity in another sense - they eat together and dance together. Three people hit their heads with eggs at the dinner table, screaming and laughing in pain. This is Wu Kangren's favorite scene.

;

;"I think the most precious thing is the smiles in life. Throughout the play, they rarely smile, and the things that are taken for granted in life are too harsh for them."

;

;In the end, Facing Master Kaizhao, Abang complained: I always wonder why I was born, I have no home, I don’t even have parents, I can only watch from a distance. I'm jealous of you.

;

;"I want to be like you. But I can't! Why is this? I want to talk, I want to be loved and liked, but there is nothing. You told me not to give up, to keep living. But I can't do it at all. I always have to be careful, alert, hiding, running away. It's not fair, I did something wrong."

;

;"My life is terrible and I want to change my life, but Impossible. I have no future."

;

;These accusations were made in sign language and facial expressions. The expressions on those who carefully observed the surroundings, the echo of the wrist chain hitting the table, and the tears that had been rolling in the eye sockets for a long time but did not fall, all made this silent accusation deafening.

;

;"Don't preach to me, I have no identity." Abang pointed to the code on his prison uniform.

;

;Master Kaizhao suddenly held Abang’s hand. Abang calmed down, tears fell, and he sobbed out incomprehensible syllables: "I want to die, I want to die, I want..."

;

;He looked around and found that no one could understand.

;

;Abang is mute, which is a fateful coupling. "A group of people without identity are just like the mute. Even if they speak out, there will be no change." Wu Kangren said.

;

;When Chen Zeyao, who played the younger brother, later saw this silent accusation on the screen, he was shocked and hurt, "It turns out that this is what Abang thinks. It turns out that he has always felt that he is a shadow. I can't be with you." I talk too much about my inner feelings because it really hurts."

;

;In the scene where the brothers bid farewell, Chen Zeyao instinctively expressed his feelings for his brother in sign language. "I burst into tears and forgot to say my lines. Later I found out that everyone can feel it even if I don't say my lines."

;

;"Abang, next time, I say next time, I will be your brother to protect you." Adi said. More than 20 years ago, street children Abang and Adi met on the street and became brothers.

;

;For Wang Lilin, the "Fudu Youth" presented now has fulfilled his expectations. "I want to talk about human emotions in the context of foreign workers in Fudu, and the precious warmth and goodwill between people in such a cruel and oppressive society."

;

;"What about Wu Kangren, right? What can we expect from "Fudu Youth"?" we asked.

;

;"Just don't lose money, it's a movie they worked so hard to make." He replied.

;

;The day after filming wrapped, Wu Kangren posted on social media: "We have done a great thing."

;

;;

;

;;(Wu Kangren’s personal social media account/picture);

;

;;Clap your hands;

;

;In 2016, Wu Kangren won the first prize with his role in "A Handful of Youth" The role of "Guo Zhen" won the Golden Bell Award for Best Actor. This is one of the most successful characters he has created, mixed with a cynical sense of youth and the vicissitudes of war and life and death, and with deep love for his lover, he was extinguished in the gunfire.

;

;His acceptance speech was like a plea: a plea for more resources for actors, a plea for TV stations to develop more different types of dramas. "They (actors) are waiting, just like me before, waiting for someone like Director Cho Sei-won to choose me. We need more resources to help us. Maybe we are not the most talented, but we can always be the most talented. The one who works hard."

;

;;

; < p style="color: #999; text-align: center;">;A handful of green (2015) ;;

;

;Relying on government subsidies and Later, with the investment of streaming media platforms, Taiwanese dramas have been innovative in the past few years. Around 2015, "A Handful of Youth" and the genre dramas "Exit Office" and "Narcotic Storm" were regarded as the first new trend. After 2019, dramas that focus on social issues, such as "The Distance Between Us" and "The Distance Between Us", mark that Taiwanese dramas have basically passed the trough period.

;

;In the above-mentioned Taiwanese dramas, Wu Kangren played the leading role. From idol dramas to realism, his acting career overlaps with the ups and downs, changes and breakthroughs of Taiwanese dramas in the past 15 years.

;

; "To be honest, I became famous because there was a shortage of people (filming) in Taiwan at that time. There were not many Taiwanese actors my age." He said in an interview with "Taiwan Film" at the end of 2018.

;

;When he entered the industry, he thought that he was not outstanding in appearance and qualifications, but "hard work is more important than talent." When he was working as a bartender, he didn't speak English, so after finishing work in the early morning, he would go to the all-night Eslite Bookstore, read bartending books, and memorize words in Pinyin. Many years later, when the media interviewed the bar owner, the bar owner described Wu Kangren as "a life on the line": a lifetime of hard work for one thing.

;

;He went through phases of conceitedness. He knows what he is doing, he gives 200%, is strict with himself, and requires everyone around him to work as hard as he does. "I used to be quite radical at work, so there were rumors that Wu Kangren was difficult to deal with. Only in the past two years have I gradually realized that this is a team work."

;

;But precisely because Wu Kangren always emphasized hard work, He often says that he is not talented enough, and few people talk about his talent as an actor.

;

;He has beautiful eyes and expressive features, which makes him good at performing explosive moments with complex emotions. He is good at observation and describes many details of the old district of Fudu vividly and vividly. Although he is taciturn and serious in daily life, when standing on the stage and in front of the camera, he is talkative and humorous, with rich expressions and body movements.

;

;He is confident that he can persist in acting and yearns to be a good actor like Li Xuejian for a lifetime, but he is also not optimistic about his career as an actor.

;

;"I don't think I will always be able to act. I just want to be exposed to many possibilities earlier and faster. It may only take three to five years to act in a film. I strive for it because of fate." He thought for a while and said, "You won't see "Fudu Youth" again in five years. I have been in the industry for 15 years and only saw "Fudu Youth" once."

;

;This is This is the reason why he tried a variety of unconventional roles after 2015. He wanted to know how many possibilities he had and how to improve his performance. He went to training classes to practice his vocal skills; he filmed 5 movies in 2022 and felt very at ease.

;

;Perhaps because he does not have an agent, Wu Kangren has limited access to film resources. He has expressed his love for mainland art films several times, and he also admitted that he respects acting in mainland China. "You have to be prepared before going, not just to make money and leave."

;

;But it is also because Without an agent, Wu Kangren makes all his work decisions by himself. After experiencing a period of panic, he is now very accustomed to this way of working: he knows what is important, and he just needs to perform well. He can take care of himself.

;

;He yearns for Hong Kong actors in the golden age of Hong Kong films, such as Tony Leung Ka-fai, Tony Leung Chiu-wai, and Andy Lau. "Each actor has accumulated hundreds of films and has his own place."

;

;;

;

;In My Lifetime (2023) ;;

;

;The title of "In My Lifetime" is Gao Jiayue's life summary. Gao Jiayue scrawled and corrected it and wrote on the back of the "suicide note": It would be good to grow this big in my lifetime.

;

;Wu Kangren started working at the age of 14. The first job was to do electrical box welding with bare eyes. After work, my vision was so white that I thought I was going blind. Since then, he has worked more than 50 jobs, shuttling between 20-story scaffolding without safety helmets and safety nets, washing dishes, cutting vegetables, and entertaining guests in various restaurants.

;

;Twenty years later, Wu Kangren was asked what he wanted to say to himself at that time. He replied:

;

;"15-year-old Wu Kangren, the things you were afraid of at that time, None of this happened, because you didn’t learn bad things, and you are taking good care of your mother now. Your decision at that time was right, and you got a wonderful life in exchange for it, so give yourself a pat on the back.”

;

;On November 2, 2023, Lin Chaomin was at the Wu Mayao Anthropology Museum of Yunnan University. (Southern Weekend reporter Su Youpeng/picture)

;
;Doctoral profile
;

;;Lin Chaomin, the first Ph.D. in Chinese ethnic history. ;

;

;;Born in Dali, Yunnan in 1944, and grew up in Tengchong, Yunnan. ;

;

;;In 1962, he was admitted to the history major of Yunnan University. ;

;

;;In 1981, he received a master's degree in history. He stayed at the school as assistant to Professor Fang Guoyu. ;

;

;;Received a doctorate in history in 1985. ;

;

;;Served successively as the director of the History Department of Yunnan University, and concurrently as the director of the Southwest Institute of Ancient Books, East Asia Director of the Institute of Film and Television Anthropology, Vice President and Inspector of Yunnan University. Director of the Chinese Historical Society, President of the Yunnan Historical Society, President of the Yunnan Chinese Society, Vice President of the Chinese Ethnology Society, Vice President of the Chinese Ethnographic History Society, Vice President of the Chinese Han Nationality Research Society, etc. ;

;

;After retirement, Lin Chaomin lives in a family courtyard near Yunnan University. It is close to Green Lake. Every winter, you can see the scenery from A red-billed gull flies from Siberia to spend the winter.

;

;In 1962, Lin Chaomin was admitted to Yunnan University as a history major. At that time, the Department of History gathered together scholars such as Fang Guoyu, Jiang Yingliang, Yang Kun, and Li Wei to establish the first Chinese ethnic history major.

;

;The first time he came into contact with the ethnic history major in a relatively systematic way was due to the "special task" Lin Chaomin was assigned before graduation: Fang Guoyu, who would become his mentor in the future. Collect "evidence of guilt" from his writings. Yunda University students only have 6 library cards, but Lin Chaomin, who shoulders the "task", after receiving 20 library cards, plunged into Fang Guoyu's works.

;

;As a result, "After reading for a long time, I didn't find anything reactionary about Mr. Fang, but I myself became interested in the study of national history."

;

;Later, due to various reasons, this class of history students who were full of expectations for the future were collectively sent to farms for re-education after six years of undergraduate studies. .

;

;In May 1970, Lin Chaomin was assigned to work as a worker in the Menghai Tea Factory in Xishuangbanna Province, and later taught in Menghai No. 1 Middle School. During this period, he was appreciated by Ren Jiyu, professor of the Department of Philosophy at Peking University, for an article discussing Confucius' thoughts.

;

;In 1978, Lin Chaomin was 33 years old. He heard that he could take the postgraduate entrance examination, so he thought of the Chinese Ethnic History major at Yunnan University. But compared with the exam, getting people released from middle school was more difficult. “I went to the then county party secretary Yan Xiangkan, who was from the Blang ethnic group. When he heard that I was going to study ethnic history, I immediately Said, 'I hope you will study the history of our Brown people carefully.'"

;

;Some people once commented that Lin Chaomin was "a pioneer in the trend." In 1985, he passed the defense , became the first doctorate in Chinese national history. One of his mentors, Jiang Yingliang, has a plan for him: "He is expected to make creative achievements in the study of ethnic history. We hope that he will not be held in administrative affairs, which will affect his research and teaching."

;

;However, after graduating from the Ph.D., he was immediately appointed as the deputy director of the History Department of Yunnan University, and later served as the vice president of Yunnan University. As an administrator, he once faced the question of where the history department should go in the face of the decline of liberal arts. At that time, in the context of difficulty in recruiting students, allocating resources, and generating income, many teachers called the history department a "shit pit" and shouted that they should jump out of the "shit pit." pit". During his tenure, Lin Chaomin successively organized and applied for history base classes, established anthropology, social work and other majors, and established the first Institute of Film and Television Anthropology in Asia, allowing this university located in the southwest border to seize the opportunity in the discipline establishment. .

;

;After retirement, Lin Chaomin can spend time on research. In recent years, he has paid special attention to the integrity of Chinese history. On October 28, 2023, he organized a seminar on Fang Guoyu's historical thoughts to commemorate the 60th anniversary of the publication of the theory "On the Integration of Chinese Historical Development" and the 120th anniversary of Fang Guoyu's birth.

;

;On November 2, 2023, on the campus of Yunnan University, Lin Chaomin accepted an exclusive interview with a reporter from Southern Weekend.

;

;;

;

;Lin Chaomin’s doctoral thesis defense scene, taken in 1985. (Interviewee/Picture)

;

;“No problem found”

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;What kind of environment did you grow up in? Has history been your aspired major since you were a child? ;

;

;;Lin Chaomin:;;I was born in Dali and grew up in Tengchong. When the Japanese occupied Tengchong in 1942, my parents fled to Dali, where I was born. After the Chinese Expeditionary Force recaptured Tengchong in September 1944, we came back from Dali. At that time, Tengchong was bombed by aircraft and artillery due to the Anti-Japanese War. The city was in rubble, with almost no standing house. The central primary school where we study is the Confucian Temple. The Japanese used it as a headquarters before. It has been preserved because of its strong construction. There are still many bullet holes in the walls and pillars inside. When I was in sixth grade, the school was building a sports ground and we dug up a lot of bullet casings and bayonets from Type 38 rifles. It wasn’t until I graduated from high school in 1962 and entered college that I left Tengchong. ;

;

;When I was young, I didn’t know what to do, I just knew that I wanted to read good books. At that time, my mother subscribed to different magazines for each age group of us brothers and sisters. For example, when I was very young, I read "Children", "Red Scarf", "Middle School Students" and "Youth Literature". Later, when I was older, I read "Students" published in the Republic of China. Youwenku". At that time, I read Lin Handa's "New Collection of Stories from the Eastern Zhou Dynasty", "New Collection of Stories from the Later and Later Han Dynasties", "Stories of the Three Kingdoms", "Tai Shi Not Afraid of Death", etc., and developed a strong interest in history.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Why did you apply in the end? History major at Yunnan University? ;

;

;;Lin Chaomin:;;My father is a technician engaged in water conservancy projects and participated in the construction of many important projects in Tengchong. Roads, ditches, reservoirs, he often told me that after the founding of the People's Republic of China, the motherland must be industrialized, and you should study engineering and work hard for modernization. My mother was a middle school teacher. During the anti-rightist movement in 1957, many liberal arts teachers in Tengchong No. 1 Middle School were misclassified. My mother said that we could not study liberal arts because it would be easy to make mistakes, so I always wanted to study science and engineering. Later, my mother also advocated that I study medicine because it would be useful at any time. In high school, I was good in all subjects, but I excelled in liberal arts. ;

;

;I was a senior in high school in 1962. After the graduation exam last semester, the school divided us into three groups according to the subjects we applied for. One group was science and engineering. The other group is medicine and agriculture, and the other group is liberal arts. My family decided to choose science and engineering, but when it came to the specific subjects, I was assigned to the liberal arts group under the arrangement of the head teacher, Chinese teacher, and history teacher. At that time, I went to Baoshan, Yunnan to take the college entrance examination, and I sent out application letters before the exam. Each person can fill in five choices, so I filled out the history departments of Peking University, Renmin University of China, Nanjing University, Fudan and Yunda University, and was later admitted to Yunda University.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Why was Yunda University at that time Is the history department a "five-year system"? ;

;

;;Lin Chaomin:;;Our history department only had one major: history, and we recruited 32 people. Only one-half of the previous one, and one-third of the previous one. The curriculum arrangement is that the first, second and third grade students take basic courses, such as ancient literature, politics, foreign languages, Chinese and foreign general history, etc., and the fourth grade is divided into "specialized (groups)". When I was studying, there were three special groups: Chinese national history, ancient Chinese economic history, and modern Chinese economic history. ;

;

;I didn’t study well when I was in college. Since 1958, labor education has been relatively common in universities. The central government formulated the Sixty Articles for Higher Education, emphasizing the emphasis on teaching. At that time, the Ministry of Education stipulated that students should attend labor classes for five weeks in a school year, which implied that it could not exceed five weeks. But in reality it’s more than five weeks of labor each school year. At that time, Yunnan University had three farms, growing rice, corn, wheat, vegetables, as well as apple orchards and pig farms. In addition, there was a lot of public welfare work, such as planting trees in the mountains, and supporting spring plowing and autumn harvesting during busy farming periods. Later, when Kunming was building a railway station, we were asked to help. In 1961, after a survey, the Ministry of Higher Education found that students had to work and go to school at the same time, and could not learn much in four years, so they decided to turn key universities into five-year institutions, and Yunda University was also changed to a five-year institution. .

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You studied under Mr. Fang Guoyu when you were a graduate student because you went to Fang Sir's class? ;

;

;;Lin Chaomin:;;When I was in college, Mr. Fang was responsible for the national task of compiling the southwest part of China’s historical map. He only teaches graduate students, and ethnic history is a senior professional course that is only taken in the fourth grade and is taught by his assistants Mr. You Zhong and Mr. Mu Qin. On April 20, 1963, Mr. Fang gave a speech on "On the Integration of China's Historical Development" at school. I met him for the first time, but because he was from Lijiang and of the Naxi ethnic group, he had a strong accent and I didn't understand much. ;

;

;But I was deeply impressed after reading the article. In September 1966, when I was a senior in college, classes were suspended again due to the "Cultural Revolution", and the school began to engage in mass criticism to criticize reactionary academic authority. At that time, Yunnan University established a large criticism group, which included a Chinese group and a history group. The history group mainly criticized the "three mountains" of the history department. The first one was Fang Guoyu who "represented" feudalism, and the second one was " Jiang Yingliang (who once served as county magistrate in Che, now Jinghong) represents "bureaucratic capitalism", and the third one "represents" imperialism is Yang Kun (studied at the University of Sino-French in Lyon, France). There are five or six classmates in the history group I am in. The group members do not need to study in the department. Two young teachers organize us to go to these old gentlemen's books and find questions from the books. The average college student only has 6 library cards. , our criticism group has 20 library cards, and can go into the library to check books. It was also at this time that I dug out all of Mr. Fang's works and read them. His "Inspection Notes on the Western Yunnan Border Area" talked about his field trips to the Awa Mountains in the Lincang border area. I was very interested in reading it and felt that it was well written. Very good, no problems found. I didn’t write an article criticizing Mr. Fang. Instead, I learned about the social history of border areas and the customs and customs of ethnic minorities, and felt that his "On the Integration of Chinese Historical Development" and other articles were good articles for safeguarding national unity.

;

;;

;

;Fang Guoyu (left 1) Instructing Lin Chaomin (second from left), photographed in Professor Fang Guoyu’s study in March 1973. (Interviewee/picture)

;

;“There are still too few people doing ethnic history in the country”

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Where did the students from the history department of Yunnan University work after graduation? Why did you end up at the tea factory? ;

;

;;Lin Chaomin:;;Many of my seniors go to colleges and universities to be teachers. The more popular ones are in the modern history group. Every school has party history. Courses are in great demand for employment. Previously, all students majoring in modern history were assigned to the General Political Department of the People's Liberation Army. In addition, many people go to the Department of Philosophy and Social Sciences of the Chinese Academy of Sciences (now the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences). At that time, Yunda University's ethnic history major was ranked first in the country. Those who studied the history of Dai, Yi, Bai, and Naxi people in the Institute of Ethnology of the Department of Philosophy and Social Sciences were all Yunda graduates. ;

;

;Logically speaking, we should have graduated in July 1967, but until October 1968, except for a few in agriculture and medicine, our group of college students Except for majors, all were sent to farms to receive re-education and labor training. It was not until April 1970 that work began to be assigned. At that time, it was stipulated that college students should achieve "four orientations", facing the grassroots, facing the countryside, facing the industry and mining, and facing the frontier. At the time of the distribution, no one wanted to go to Xishuangbanna. I read Mr. Fang's "Inspection Notes on the Western Yunnan Border Region", Mr. Jiang Yingliang's "Economic Life of the Paiyi", "Life and Culture of the Paiyi", etc., and I was very interested in the border ethnic groups, so I Take the initiative to sign up to go to Xishuangbanna. In May 1970, when I arrived in Menghai County, Xishuangbanna, I was assigned to be a worker in the Menghai Tea Factory. I was transferred to the factory from time to time to write work summaries, publicity reports, etc. In 1972, Menghai No. 1 Middle School opened a high school and needed high school teachers, but the factory refused to let them go. It wasn’t until 1973 that I was transferred as a history and Chinese teacher.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;I heard you are When working at the Menghai Tea Factory, he was also appreciated by Professor Ren Jiyu of Peking University? ;

;

;;Lin Chaomin:;;I work 8 hours a day in the tea factory, and the rest of the time is my own. When I was in college, I was very interested in the history of Chinese thought. I read Hou Wailu's "General History of Chinese Thought", Zhao Jibin's "A New Exploration of the Analects", Guo Moruo's "Ten Critiques", etc., and took notes. When I went to Menghai, I brought a copy of the "Four Books" with me. In his spare time, he wrote an article about Confucius' thought and sent it to Professor Li Cuo in the department for his advice. He gave the article to Professor Zhang Deguang, an expert in the history of ancient Chinese thought, and Mr. Zhang recommended it to Ren Jiyu. Mr. Ren wrote me back a letter, saying that in a remote place like Xishuangbanna, it was not easy for me to persist in studying Confucius and write such an article. However, he also pointed out that my article did not criticize Confucius enough. Mr. Ren also sent me a copy of "A Brief History of Chinese Philosophy" edited by him. ;

;

;In 1972, Mr. Ren wrote to me and told me that Peking University was preparing to recruit 10 graduate students in the history of Chinese philosophy. He hoped that I would be ready. Admitted to his graduate school. So I studied foreign languages ​​every day, systematically studied the history of Chinese philosophy, and often wrote to him for advice. But then the Zhang Tiesheng hand-in-the-blank incident happened, and Mr. Ren wrote to me to tell me that the recruitment of graduate students had been stopped, and that in the future, graduate students would also be recruited through the recommendation of workers, peasants and soldiers. I wouldn't have a chance.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Until 1978, it was restored During the postgraduate enrollment period, you were finally able to take the postgraduate entrance examination, but why didn’t you contact Professor Ren Jiyu again? ;

;

;;Lin Chaomin:;;I also thought about writing to Mr. Ren and doing research on the history of philosophy with him, but I was in Xishuangbanna at the time, and my thoughts changed. Big changes. I lived among the Dai, Lahu, Bulang, and Hani people, and found that I had no idea about their history. Later, when I became a middle school teacher, some students asked me questions about ethnic minorities, and I couldn’t answer them. , at this time, I remembered the research on ethnic minorities by Mr. Fang Guoyu and Mr. Jiang Yingliang. I felt that there were more people doing the history of philosophy in the country, but too few people doing the history of ethnic groups, which was not popular, so I chose to study under Mr. Fang’s graduate school. ;

;

;;

;

;In the 1960s, Lin Chaomin planted vegetables and watered vegetables on the PLA farm . (Interviewee/picture)

;

;“Understanding ethnic minorities from the perspective of multi-ethnic unity”

;

;;Southern Weekend: < /strong>;;What things impressed you deeply when doing research with Mr. Fang? ;

;

;;Lin Chaomin:;;In the first class of graduate school, Mr. Fang took me to the library He asked me to read a book in a classical library and report back a week later. I didn’t understand it at that time. When I was reporting, he asked me how many books I had read. I said I had only read a few books, and he said it’s not good for you to read books like this. I read them one book at a time, but flipped through the bookshelves one by one. He asked me to start with bibliography and read books such as "Summary of the General Catalog of All Siku", "Diagnosis of Synopsis of Siku" by Yu Jiaxi, and "Answers to the Bibliography" by Zhang Zhidong. ;

;

;Mr. Fang has never criticized me directly. When I was studying for my master's degree, I wrote some small articles in "Yunnan Daily". Mr. Fang just said, You haven't read enough books yet. What you posted in "Yunnan Daily" is just a trivial skill, building blocks. Your task is to build a tall building. You must lay a good foundation, read more and read good books, and make creative achievements in the future.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;For doctoral training, did Mr. Fang require you to publish a paper? What are the word count requirements for reading books and graduation thesis? ;

;

;;Lin Chaomin:;;Mr. Fang has not set these goals. He does not advocate rushing to publish articles and believes that first Read good books. He said that no article should be refried, and if there is no new idea, don’t write an article. He said that some people nowadays do not study seriously, but are busy writing articles, rushing to publish articles, and eager for quick success. Many articles are about stir-fried twice-cooked pork. This won't work! Doctoral students do not use pigs raised by others to make steamed pork, Qianzhang pork, or braised pork. Instead, they have to cultivate new pig species themselves, create something, and invent something. ;

;

;Later, I summarized doctoral studies as having all five "unique" aspects. It means independent personality, independent thinking, unique insights, unique approaches, and uniqueness.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;I have noticed that in recent years You have mentioned the unified view of history on many occasions. Is this inherited from Mr. Fang? ;

;

;;Lin Chaomin:;;All of Mr. Fang’s research is related to national unity and national unity. In 1939, Mr. Fang wrote "Bo People and Baizi" and published it in "Yi Shi Bao", criticizing the fallacy of the British and French in describing Nanzhao as an independent country established by the Dai people. His study of border issues was not only In order to examine historical issues, but to maintain national unity and national unity. ;

;

;In 1963, Mr. Fang published "On the Integration of China's Historical Development" and began to talk about the integrity of China's historical development. The article aims at the absurd remarks of some scholars at home and abroad who regard Chinese history as a single history of the Han people and exclude the history of non-Han Chinese ethnic minorities from Chinese history. It points out that the development of Chinese history has always been a whole, and that history and reality, the Central Plains and the Central Plains are The border areas, the Han and ethnic minorities, the Chinese nation, etc. are all one entity. Chinese history refers to the history of the people of all ethnic groups living on this land. It should include their entire history and cannot be "changed or expanded." Chinese history has its own integrity. Within the whole, no matter how many regimes appear and no matter how inconsistent the politics, the whole has not been broken. China as a whole should be the scope of history, not the territory of past dynasties. .

;

;Later I assisted Mr. Fang in teaching the local history of Yunnan, and he reiterated this point of view in the introduction to "Lecture Notes on the Local History of Yunnan". When Yunnan University celebrated its 70th anniversary in 1983, he guided me to write an article called "Several Issues Related to the Thirty-seven Alliance Oath Monuments in Dali", which also used this monument to talk about the unification of Chinese history.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;From an international perspective , some historians may also hold other views on the unified view of history. How should we understand the border issue? ;

;

;;Lin Chaomin:;;Border issues are relatively complex. In the past, China had no border issues, only the relationship between China and the four barbarians, which meant the "five-party republic" between China and the four barbarians and "the unification of the world, the seamless connection between China and barbarians". From the central to the local governments, they were one whole. Even during the period of division, both Han and ethnic minorities pursued "unification of the world" and regarded the dynasties they established as Chinese orthodoxy; the dynasty systems they established were based on inheriting the Qin and Han systems and did not change the overall Economic, political, and cultural structures. Because all ethnic groups have lived together for a long time, they have already formed a complementary and unified production and lifestyle, which has given birth to a very inclusive and absorbing Chinese civilization, allowing the Chinese nation to form a strong cohesion based on "commonality". Even during the period of division, this way of production and life has not changed, the political system has not changed, the overall consciousness has not changed, and the culture has continued. This is reflected in the national outlook and national outlook as the "grand unified" national outlook and the overall consciousness of the Chinese nation. ;

;

;Modern frontier studies began to rise because of the arrival of Western colonialism from the East. The first is the political "frontier". In history, the division and reunification of many places was a process of development. For example, Yunnan was Nanzhao in the Tang Dynasty. In the 10th year of Zhenyuan (794), the Yunnan Pacifying Department was established, and the Jiannan Jiedushi was appointed as the Yunnan Pacifying Envoy. It is an autonomous local government. Dali State was also an autonomous local government. Mongolia pacified Dali in 1253, and the Yuan Dynasty established a province in Yunnan in 1274. The Yuan Dynasty also established the province of Myanmar, which was later placed under the administration of Yunnan Province. It is a chieftain land under the jurisdiction of Yunnan Province. After the founding of New China, the China-Myanmar border was officially delimited in 1961. China erected the No. 1 boundary monument of the People's Republic of China on the border with Tengchong. Indicates that we formally respect the demarcation of borders under international law, that is, borders under international law.

;

;There are also cultural borders. For example, the culture of the Wa people in China and the Wa state in northern Myanmar have many similarities. Although there are political boundaries at this time, But in fact, we all have the same culture and history, and we are a community with a shared future. Therefore, from a domestic perspective, it is the integrity of the Chinese nation, and from a foreign perspective, it should be regarded as a community. Domestically, we safeguard China's integrity and safeguard national unity. Internationally, we build a community with a shared future for mankind.

;

;;

;

;Lin Chaomin's The doctoral thesis is titled "Anbeiting Protectorate and the Western Frontier of the Tang Dynasty", taken in 1985. (Interviewee/picture)

;

;“To move forward, we must ask about the past”

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;After passing your doctoral defense at the end of May 1985, you became the deputy director of the History Department of Yunnan University. In the context of the decline of liberal arts at that time, you faced What problems? ;

;

;;Lin Chaomin:;;At that time, basic subjects in liberal arts and sciences generally faced problems such as difficulty in enrollment, allocation, and funding, and history was no exception. Each department wants to generate income. Teachers in the Department of Economics and Foreign Languages, for example, can give lectures and tutors to earn extra money. Although the salary is the same, their extra money is several times that of ours. At that time, some teachers majoring in history said that they should think beyond the "shit" pit". ;

;

;Students' thoughts were not very stable, so I put forward a point of view. History may seem useless, but useless things are very useful. I told the students that the tables, chairs, benches, doors, windows, and lights in the classroom are all useful, but what is invisible and useless is the space. But without this space, there would be nowhere to put the tables, chairs, benches, and lights. History is human time and space. You can't see or touch it, but you can't live without it at all times. It's very useful anytime and anywhere.

;

;Later, the Ministry of Education proposed to build 10 "bases" in each of the three major categories of literature, history, and philosophy. When the document was issued to the school, it was less than the application deadline. For 5 days, I filled out the application form day and night, and stated at the review meeting that Yunnan University is a border university, inferior to Peking University, Fudan University, etc. in many aspects, but its research on border issues and ethnic issues is unique in the country and is related to national unity. , national unity, which is irreplaceable by other schools. The characteristics of the History Department of Yunda University are borderlands and ethnic groups, which cannot be replaced by any other school. In this way, in 1987, Yunda University became one of the 10 bases. The base class has brought new opportunities to Yunda University. The state invests 300,000 yuan in construction funds for the base class every year, and more than half of the students can be recommended to graduate school. Employment after graduation is no longer a problem.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Later, you also Did you encounter any difficulties in establishing the ethnology and social work majors? ;

;

;;Lin Chaomin:;;In 1986, I proposed that Yunda University should establish an ethnology major, and the school leaders were very supportive. , reported to the Yunnan Provincial Education Commission, the Education Commission said that ethnology is run by the Nationalities College, and it is not appropriate to have two ethnology majors in one province. In the end, it was not completed. Later, I rewrote the report and applied to establish the anthropology major. In 1987, the State Education Commission approved Yunda to establish the anthropology major. We are the second anthropology major in a national university. The first one is Xiamen University, and the first one with an anthropology department is Sun Yat-sen University. In 1988, we enrolled the first batch of undergraduate students. ;

;

;After the Anthropology major was established in 1988, I began to plan to apply for the Sociology major. In July 1939, Wu Wenzao founded the Department of Sociology at Yunda University. By 1954, the Department of Sociology was abolished, and the head of the department at that time was Mr. Yang Kun. In 1984 and 1986, I visited Mr. Yang twice at the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences. Mr. Yang repeatedly told me that it was wrong to abolish the Department of Sociology and that it should be restored and rebuilt as soon as possible. I brought his opinions back to school and reported them to the leaders. Although they were ignored, I always kept his words in mind.

;

;In October 1990, I visited the United States to study. I knew that social work is a major that is very needed by society. Social development will bring many problems and requires specialized professionals. Social workers come to the rescue. Both rich and poor have social problems. When I passed through Hong Kong when I returned to China, I went to some universities to learn about the social work major. One of their social work features is to help disadvantaged groups, the poor, the unemployed, the disabled, etc. After I came back, I told the school that if the sociology major could not be offered, we would not be able to offer it. Social work major. At that time, most people in the academic affairs office of the school did not know what social work was, so I explained it over and over again. After the school agreed, it was reported to the Provincial Education Commission and the National Education Commission, and it was quickly approved. We were the successor of Nankai University and China Youth University of Political Science. The third house.

;

;For a long time, some people imitated her, some people disdained her, and there were more and more discussions about her. However, Yi Mengling rarely fought with netizens, and she still only exported life related to herself. Fragment.

;

;She also occasionally responds to some controversial discussions. For example, "Big Mouth" brings a signature smile, but also brings ridicule. For example, after recording her first experience in acting and variety shows, netizens compared her with female celebrities because of her acting skills and appearance. It takes courage to try different things and challenge different things, but she thinks the process of taking the challenge is cool, and she is also cool if she chooses to challenge herself. ;

;Everyone likes Yi Mengling. In addition to her beauty, they also like her calm personality. Many times, she is trying her best to relieve some anxiety and output some positive energy. Yi Mengling said: "Try not to fall into the vicious circle of self-evidence. After all, explanations are never-ending."

;

;She is an amateur and has a place on the Internet with her own advantages. It seems that all internet celebrities can be found in her, but she cannot be classified into the same category as anyone. Yi Mengling's story may not be complicated, but no matter what, she fought her way out of the siege in a place where the fighting was more intense. To a certain extent, whether the public recognizes it or not, she has courage, tenacity and strength beyond her age.

;

;About an ordinary girl becoming the focus of the spotlight, how does she face all this? The following is Yi Mengling’s answer.

;

;"Rather than being self-consistent, it is better to say that I am trying to find growth here"

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Do you still remember the turning points that you think are important? Are you adapting to this (whether it’s attention or controversy) smoothly? Was there a process of psychological construction? ;

;

;;Yi Mengling: ;;Maybe this is my first time to participate in the recording of a variety show. Facing various evaluations, I think it is both encouragement and motivation. ;

;

;

;;Yi Mengling: ;;There will definitely be, but I am a forgetful person. I will only take the initiative to remember happy things. Don’t let internal friction take up too much time. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Today’s Internet environment is actually very harsh. You How do you achieve self-consistency? ;

;

;;Yi Mengling: ;;Because everyone on the Internet wants to express their thoughts more, I will distinguish some comments, accept them or laugh. Let it go. Rather than being self-consistent, it is better to say that I am trying to find growth in this. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;I think you have many brave actions, For example, challenge yourself in areas you have never tried before, and generously share your tips for taking photos. How do you walk the line between getting closer to everyone and remaining mysterious? ;

;

;;Yi Mengling: ;;You don’t have to choose between being close to everyone and staying mysterious. Share as much as you want to share, and do it in your own time. Will return to his own nest. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;What qualities do you most admire in yourself? Do you think you have always persisted in your particularly good places? ;

;

;;Yi Mengling: ;;My mentality is relatively good. In current terms, I may be emotionally stable. A good mood is the cornerstone of doing everything well. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;I have seen all kinds of things about you Comments, one point worth discussing is that people think you are young and promising, and have everything. Does having such achievements at such an age make you feel confused or confused at certain moments? ;

;

;;Yi Mengling: ;;I think I am still far away from having everything. But I know that I am a relatively lucky girl, and based on good luck, I will also work harder. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;What will you do in private to maintain Self-import? After all, your job and identity require a lot of output. ;

;

;;Yi Mengling:;;In addition to traveling to different places and meeting people from all walks of life, a new hobby I have this year is listening to podcasts . Listening to podcasts is a good choice when doing housework at home or taking a bath. The content of many programs is very current, and the angles and viewpoints are also very novel. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Our theme this time is "New Faces" ", what "new things" do you think you bring to everyone? New also means not repeating yourself, which means a lot. What is the state or appearance that you hope to always maintain? ;

;

;;Yi Mengling: ;;Trying different challenges, breaking conventions and comfort zones are all things I want to show everyone the new me. I want my status to be undefined. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;You feel that you have gained Which ones are worth losing, and which ones are lost that you really don’t want to lose? ;

;

;;Yi Mengling: ;;I think the biggest gain is my growth. From a child who didn’t understand anything, to now I have become a person worth going to. The "adults" I rely on have made a lot of progress in both my abilities and my mentality. What I regret to lose may still be some "willful rights". In the past, I could post whatever I wanted, and there would not be so many interpretations. Now, as a public figure, I really need to restrain myself with words and deeds. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Do you think it is very important to prove yourself? Difficult things? At what point did you have a strong desire to prove yourself? Or say no? ;

;

;;Yi Mengling: ;;I am more of a "Buddha". Nothing must be proven to someone. Everything in the process must be proven. Do your best and leave the result to time and fate. ;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;What will you do to eliminate your own bad habits? mood? ;

;

;;Yi Mengling: ;;Go travel, nature will give you the most primitive healing and peace. When you are far away from the city, you will feel that the starry sky is infinite, and we are just a small dot on one of the planets. In a long time, the things we encounter are actually so insignificant. ;
